page.title: 06The Downe Arms
page.content: new building so it had to be built on the crown of the hill,hence the separate sites.The Vicar for both churches is the Rev E Richards. {The Downe Arms Built in 1725 as a farm house, the Downe Arms was converted to an inn when the road through Wykeham was improved, it became a staging post for the stagecoach traffic.First known as the Bull Inn, it took its present name in 1872. The original building has remained virtually unaltered, even through construction of the new west wing . The Old Bar in this free house is unchanged. Construction of an extention took place from 1975 to 1977.The architect was Sir Martyn Beckett, who, has erected an elegant stone building, its design inspired by an 18th century orangery.
